TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit DataFormats extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a set of predefined data format names that can be used to identify data formats available in the clipboard or drag-and-drop operations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface use the static formats defined by DataFormats to describe each data format that is stored in a data object. Data objects are typically used for transferring data to and from the system clipboard, and in drag-and-drop operations.
The following table lists the values of the static data format fields provided by DataFormats. These field values are provided for informational purposes only; in general, code should always refer to the appropriate field, rather than hard-coded strings.
|Field|Field Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap>|"Bitmap"|Specifies a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] bitmap data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.CommaSeparatedValue>|"CSV"|Specifies a comma-separated value (CSV) data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Dib>|"DeviceIndependentBitmap"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dib](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-dib-md.md)] data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Dif>|"DataInterchangeFormat"|Specifies the Windows Data Interchange Format (DIF) data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.EnhancedMetafile>|"EnhancedMetafile"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] enhanced metafile format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop>|"FileDrop"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] file drop format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Html>|"HTML Format"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_html](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-html-md.md)] data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Locale>|"Locale"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] locale (culture) data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.MetafilePicture>|"MetaFilePict"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] metafile picture data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.OemText>|"OEMText"|Specifies the standard [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_oem](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-oem-md.md)] text data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Palette>|"Palette"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] palette data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.PenData>|"PenData"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] pen data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Riff>|"RiffAudio"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_riff](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-riff-md.md)] audio data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Rtf>|"Rich Text Format"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_rtf](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Serializable>|"PersistentObject"|Specifies a data format that encapsulates any type of serializable data objects.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.StringFormat>|"System.String"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] string class data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.SymbolicLink>|"SymbolicLink"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] symbolic link data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Text>|"Text"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ansi](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ansi-md.md)] text data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Tiff>|"TaggedImageFileFormat"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText>|"UnicodeText"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_unicode](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] text data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio>|"WaveAudio"|Specifies the wave audio data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Xaml>|"Xaml"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.XamlPackage>|"XamlPackage"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] package data format.|

## Remarks A bitmap represents a computer graphic as an array of bits in memory, and these bits represent the attributes of the individual pixels in an image.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

Docs.summary: Specifies a comma-separated value (CSV) data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This format is a basic interchange format commonly used by spreadsheets.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

## Remarks [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_dib](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-dib-md.md)] is a file format designed to ensure that bitmapped graphics created using one application can be loaded and displayed in another application exactly the way they appeared in the originating application.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

Docs.summary: Specifies the Windows Data Interchange Format (DIF) data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks DIF is a format consisting of ASCII codes in which database, spreadsheet, and similar documents can be structured to facilitate their use by and transfer to other programs.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

## Remarks The enhanced metafile format is a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] file that stores an image in terms of graphic objects rather than pixels. When resized, a metafile preserves an image better than a bitmap.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

## Remarks Use this format to interact with shell file drags during drag-and-drop operations.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.DataFormat GetDataFormat(int32 id) cil managed

Docs.param: The numeric ID of the data format to request a object for.
Docs.summary: Returns a object that defines a name and numeric ID for the specified data format. The desired data format is specified by numeric ID.
Docs.returns: A object that contains the numeric ID and the name of the requested data format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can also be used to register new formats. If the specified format cannot be found, it is automatically registered as a new data format.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.DataFormat GetDataFormat(string format) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the data format to request a object for.
Docs.summary: Returns a object that defines a name and numeric ID for the specified data format. The desired data format is specified by name (a string).
Docs.returns: A object that contains the numeric ID and the name of the requested data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method can also be used to register new formats. If the specified format cannot be found, it is automatically registered as a new data format.
Use of this method requires that the caller have <xref:System.Security.Permissions.UIPermission> with the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.UIPermissionClipboard?displayProperty=fullName>
flag set. The following code shows the attribute syntax to request this permission for an assembly.
```c# [assembly: SecurityPermissionAttribute(SecurityAction.RequestMinimum, Flags = UIPermissionClipboard.AllClipboard)] ```
```vb# <assembly: SecurityPermissionAttribute(SecurityAction.RequestMinimum, Flags := UIPermissionClipboard.AllClipboard)> ```

Docs.permission: for accessing low-level unmanaged code that supports the registration of clipboard formats. Associated enumeration:

remarks.format:
## Remarks This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

Docs.summary: Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] metafile picture data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The metafile picture format is a Windows file that stores an image in terms of graphic objects rather than pixels. When resized, a metafile preserves an image better than a bitmap.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

Docs.summary: Specifies the standard [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_oem](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-oem-md.md)] text data format.

remarks.format:

To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

## Remarks [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] pen data consists of pen strokes for handwriting software.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

## Remarks [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_riff](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-riff-md.md)] is a broad-based specification, designed to be used in defining standard formats for different types of multimedia files.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

## Remarks [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_rtf](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] is an adaptation of Document Content Architecture that is used for transferring formatted text documents between applications.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

Docs.summary: Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] symbolic link data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A symbolic link is a disk directory entry that takes the place of a directory entry for a file, but is actually a reference to a file in a different directory. A symbolic link may also be referred to an alias, shortcut, soft link, or symlink.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

## Remarks This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

## Remarks [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_tiff](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-tiff-md.md)] is a standard file format commonly used for scanning, storage, and interchanges of gray-scale graphic images.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

## Remarks This data format denotes 16-bit character encoded Unicode, also referred to as UTF-16, and UCS-2.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

Docs.summary: Specifies the wave audio data format.

## Remarks [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml#initcap](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xamlsharpinitcap-md.md)] is an XML-based language used to represent a tree of objects. Events generated by these objects can be handled using any [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)] programming language. In [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] is typically used to describe user interfaces (UI), documents, and media experiences.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

## Remarks This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.
